channel.title: People's History Podcast
channel.description: A documentary series about struggles in the United States. Each six-episode season covers one local story, told from the viewpoint of working-class people. Produced by Jacobin with support from the Economic Hardship Reporting Project.
channel.itunes:author: Jacobin
channel.itunes:keywords: peoples history, a people's history, zinn, people, history, howard zinn
channel.itunes:summary: A documentary series about struggles in the United States. Each six-episode season covers one local story, told from the viewpoint of working-class people. Produced by Jacobin with support from the Economic Hardship Reporting Project.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast about class struggle in the United States.

item.title: 6. False Hope
item.description: Episode six from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." Columbia Point tenants face new management and a private police force. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Columbia Point tenants face new management and a private police force.
item.itunes:subtitle: Columbia Point tenants face new management and a private police force.

item.title: 5. Carson Beach
item.description: Episode five from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." In the turmoil of busing, Betty Ann Jones advocates armed defense while Betty Washington and Dorothy Haskins lead a wade-in to protest segregation. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: In the turmoil of busing, Betty Ann Jones advocates armed defense while Betty Washington and Dorothy Haskins lead a wade-in to protest segregation.
item.itunes:subtitle: In the turmoil of busing, Betty Ann Jones advocates armed defense while Betty Washington and Dorothy Haskins lead a wade-in to protest segregation.

item.title: 4. Free Breakfast
item.description: Episode four from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." Sisters Angie Irving and Linda Wade bring the Black Panthers to Columbia Point. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Sisters Angie Irving and Linda Wade bring the Black Panthers to Columbia Point.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sisters Angie Irving and Linda Wade bring the Black Panthers to Columbia Point.

item.title: 3. Rent strike
item.description: Episode three from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." Tenants take their growing dissatisfaction and aim it at their landlord, the Boston Housing Authority. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Tenants take their growing dissatisfaction and aim it at their landlord, the Boston Housing Authority.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tenants take their growing dissatisfaction and aim it at their landlord, the Boston Housing Authority.

item.title: 2. Grove Hall
item.description: Episode two from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." Welfare rights advocates in Boston public housing use militant tactics to get services they are owed. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: As urban rebellions arise in cities, welfare rights advocates in Boston public housing use militant tactics to get services they are owed.
item.itunes:subtitle: As urban rebellions arise in cities, welfare rights advocates in Boston public housing use militant tactics to get services they are owed.

item.title: 1. Placement
item.description: Episode one from season one of Jacobin's People's History Podcast, "The Point: Rebellion and Resistance in Boston Public Housing." Mothers at Columbia Point, a new public housing project, organize to try and close the city dump. Support us on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/peopleshistorypod
item.dc:creator: People's History Podcast
item.itunes:summary: Mothers at Columbia Point, a new public housing project in Boston, organize to try and close the city dump.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mothers at Columbia Point, a new public housing project in Boston, organize to try and close the city dump.
